# cellClass

**Instance Property**

The subclass of [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSCell] that the matrix uses when creating new (empty) cells.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var cellClass: AnyClass { get set }
```

## Discussion

The value of this property should be the id of a subclass of [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSCell], which can be obtained by sending the `class` message to either the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSCell] subclass object or to an instance of that subclass. The default cell class is that set with the class method `setCellClass(_:)`, or [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSActionCell] if no other default cell class has been specified.

You need to use this property only with matrices initialized with [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSMatrix/init(frame:)], because the other initializers allow you to specify an instance-specific cell class or cell prototype.

## Related Documentation

- **insertColumn(_:)**: Inserts a new column of cells at the specified location.
- **addRow()**: Adds a new row of cells below the last row.
- **addColumn()**: Adds a new column of cells to the right of the last column.
- **insertRow(_:)**: Inserts a new row of cells before the specified row.
- **makeCell(atRow:column:)**: Creates a new cell at the location specified by the given row and column in the receiver.

## Managing the Cell Class

- **prototype**: The prototype cell that’s copied whenever the matrix creates a new cell.
